Articles.Content:
.

Edited April 4, 2022 by spacejet
It isn't possible as far as we know. The way the planets are made doesn't allow modifications to the planets textures and colliders in game.
Yes, but at least give us caves and lava tubes!

11 hours ago, shdwlrd said:

It isn't possible as far as we know. The way the planets are made doesn't allow modifications to the planets textures and colliders in game. 

The way I see it, excavation could remove the planet collider in a specific volume and replace it with a set of colliders to simulate surface under the removed ground. But that would probably be a development nightmare.

.

Edited April 4, 2022 by spacejet
Yeah i want voxel physics so bad. I want to actually blow the mun up.

On 3/20/2022 at 10:32 AM, KarolOfGutovo said:

The way I see it, excavation could remove the planet collider in a specific volume and replace it with a set of colliders to simulate surface under the removed ground. But that would probably be a development nightmare.

This is a fantastic way to create null pointer errors, overlapping colliders that cause unexpected behavior and just generally cause instability. 

On 3/20/2022 at 9:50 PM, siklidkid said:

Yeah i want voxel physics so bad. I want to actually blow the mun up.

Voxel would absolutely destroy a game the size of KSP, since for each point you have to be constantly updating the other three.

Basically there's a reason SE is much smaller than KSP.

They could have premade, premeshed cave models that they clip into the terrain, but that's about it.

1 minute ago, Incarnation of Chaos said:

This is a fantastic way to create null pointer errors, overlapping colliders that cause unexpected behavior and just generally cause instability. 

Voxel would absolutely destroy a game the size of KSP, since for each point you have to be constantly updating the other three.

Basically there's a reason SE is much smaller than KSP.

They could have premade, premeshed cave models that they clip into the terrain, but that's about it.

Premeshed cave models are cool. I like caves.
